oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mike Seeger Live Performance - January 24, 1970
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recordings are compromised from a live recording of Mike Seeger (entertainer). The recordings are from January 24, 1970.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mike Seeger
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mike Seeger jokes about the longevity of his career and president Lyndon B. Johnson -- (01:49) Freight Train (Mike Seeger) -- (05:15) Seeger recalls purchasing his banjo -- (07:23) Around Nashville (Mike Seeger) -- (10:36) Seeger discusses leather britches -- (11:30) Leather Breeches (Mike Seeger) -- (12:58) Seeger reflects on the lasting nature of country songs -- (13:53) Coo Coo Bird (Mike Seeger) -- (16:50) Seeger introduces "Lord Thomas and Fair Ellender" -- (17:43) Lord Thomas and Fair Ellender (Mike Seeger) -- (21:54) Seeger jokes about using his auto-harp -- (22:52) Bile That Cabbage Down (Mike Seeger) -- (24:54) Seeger introduces "Bonaparte's Retreat" -- (26:26) Bonaparte's Retreat (Mike Seeger) -- (29:18) The Old Fish Song (Mike Seeger) -- (32:02) Seeger jokingly tunes his fiddle -- (32:31) The Old Fish Song (Mike Seeger) -- (34:19) Seeger addresses the crowd about "Fishing Blues" -- (34:57) Fishing Blues (Mike Seeger) -- (38:53) Seeger reflects on the recent difficulties in his music -- (41:56) The Wildwood Weed (Mike Seeger) -- (45:40) Seeger asks the audience what song he should play next -- (48:24) I've Been All Around This World (Mike Seeger)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Seeger, Mike;
